titleInfo.title: Letter No. 60 of 1850 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay, to Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter relates to the suppression of the slave trade in the Persian Gulf. The letter is a covering letter sent with an enclosed letter, itself with another letter as an enclosure. The enclosed letter (ff 10-11) is from A. Galloway and John Shepherd, East India House, London, to the Government in Council, Bombay, dated 11 January 1850. Its enclosure is a copy of a letter sent by the British Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs to the British Minister at Tehran, Colonel Justin Sheil, requesting that the Persian Government consent to allowing British and East India Company vessels to stop and search vessels sailing under the Persian flag, if suspected of transporting slaves.
